events.title: End the greenwash - Drax court case demonstration
events.description:
Drax Power Station has been summoned to court to answer to allegations of endangering hundreds of its workers health by exposing them to dangerous levels of wood dust air pollution.

We must hold Drax to account, and not let this go unnoticed. So join the Axe Drax coalition in a protest outside the court.

If you can't turn up in person, please do still sign up. There will be online actions for you to take part in, that are vital for getting the word out.

More about Drax from the Friends of the Earth here, and read Biofuelwatch's campaign briefing here.


Sign up to join the campaign here: axedrax.uk/signup
events.instructions:
If you can, bring a green or white bit of "washing" with one of Drax's many crimes on it. We will hang up their green washing for all to see! Some examples of their crimes:

  • Poisoning workers
  • Harming communities
  • Polluting the air
  • Bribing MPs

And anything else you can think of.

events.title: Support Drax train blockader summoned to police station
events.description:
The lone protester, Coffee, who stopped a train containing wood and pelletised trees heading to be burned in Drax Power Station has been summoned to attend Fulford Road Police station at 1pm on 20th December 2021.

We are expecting her to be charged, but don't know what for. One possible charge could see a maximum sentence of life in prison. We will join her in solidarity âœŠ?
events.instructions: Make sure to bring a warm coat!

events.title: Health and safety over profit - protest while Drax in court
events.description:
The Health and Safety Executive is taking Drax Power Station to court on 30th November. Drax is accused of exposing employees to wood dust at its Selby plant, thereby risking their "health, safety and welfare at work".

This comes soon after Drax was fined $2.5 million for breaching air pollution laws in it's tree mills in the USA.

Drax's green mask is slipping. It is time for us to rise up, speak out and protest.

Meet in Park Square, just across the way from the court.

There will be loads of ways to get involved online too.
events.instructions: Meet in Park Square, we will email with more details!

location.venue: Leeds Magistrates' Court and Family Court
